history.content: <md>My advice would be to take whichever course you think will be more challenging for you over the summer. This is because, as you mentioned, whatever course you take over the summer you can devote your full attention to, and because you have nothing else in your schedule to conflict with, you can attend lots of OH for help if you need it. **I would recommend basing this decision on your background.** For example, for me personally I took CS70 over the summer (as opposed to any other CS course) because while I had a very strong programming background, I did not have any background in proof-based mathematics or probability, so I (correctly) reasoned CS70 would take more effort on my part to do well compared to a programming-based class.</md>

children.subject:
Honestly I think most people would get more out of 61BL than 70. I love 70 (I'm an AI, CSM mentor, and 370 tutor for 70) and always recommend it but I don't think most people will come up with that much understanding from rushing it in the summer vs spreading it over a full semester and really digesting the topics. I cant imagine doing 70 at twice the pace in the summer.

But 61B is annoyingly slow if you have programmed in Java before, and if you like programming and want to really get a solid way to understand data structures for internships then I think 61BL is a great opportunity as the instructors are super qualified to teach it and the projects give you a lot of experience (writing a deque, gitlet, and bearmaps per https://cs61bl.org/su21/ could give anyone a great way to spend their summer looking at the future) and the labs give you a lot of coding experience which you don't see in a regular 61B offering. Just because of the lab feature, I would recommend 61B summer, both are definitely hard but I think no matter how you do, you would walk away with more from 61BL

history.content:
Hey!

I have seen some discussions about this question, but I am not certain which one to take over summer. I heard that cs 70 is harder and would be better to take over summer to focus on that course only. But cs 61b over summer is lab-based, which means there would be more programming that theory.

Any advice would be highly appreciated.

thanks
history.subject: CS 70 or 61B over summer
